item.title: Please use the "IN" operador
item.description: It’s not the first timeÂ I see people that, to select feature by their fields values, use expressions like this: [code language=“SQL”]“field” = ‘value1’ OR “field” = ‘value2’ OR “field” = ‘value3’ [OR …][/code] A more practical and pretty way of doing this is by using the IN operator instead. [code language=“SQL”]“field” IN (‘value1’,‘value2’,‘value3’[,…])[/code] This operator is available in almost every GIS software I know. In QGIS, it can be used even if there isn’t a small little button to click.
